PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSES :
1. Diverticulitis .
2. Hypertension .
HISTORY :
This is a **AGE[in 60s]- year - old white female who presented with nausea , vomiting , diarrhea , and abdominal pain .
CT scan showed severe diverticulitis .
The patient was admitted to a regular bed and started on IV antibiotics consisting of Cipro and Flagyl along with a surgical consult .
Dr. **NAME[XXX] saw the patient and felt that the patient wants to receive the proper treatment , did not need a colonoscopy , and further treatment .
On the day of discharge , her abdomen was much better , tolerating her increased diet , and she was afebrile .
Her white count had come down to 8.8 , a normal range .
At the time of discharge , she was stable .
She will continue on Cipro 500 mg b.i.d. for 6 days and Flagyl 500 mg t.i.d. for 6 days .
She will continue lisinopril for hypertension and Pepcid p.r.n. for abdominal discomfort .
At the time of discharge , she was stable .
She will follow up with me in approximately 10 to 14 days .
Patient care time 35 minutes .
